metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 43 axioms covering monitoring processes, trigger conditions, monitoring characteristics, frequency, and failure modes including environmental surveillance and goal-relevant event detection
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified monitoring processes, defeasible conditions, and environmental awareness

axioms.title: Definition of monitor - perception-based triggering
axioms.fol: (forall (e a s e1 e2) (if (and (monitor' e a s)(member e1 s)(instance e2 e1)(perceive a e2) (goalRelevant e2 a)(etc)) (exists (e3) (and (inFocus' e3 e2 a)(cause e e3)))))
axioms.english: Agent a monitors a set s of eventuality types. When a goal-relevant instance of any of these is perceived, this causes the agent to focus on that instance. This axiom is defeasible because sometimes we miss significant threats and opportunities even though we are monitoring for them.

axioms.title: Definition of monitor - existence-based triggering
axioms.fol: (forall (e a s e1 e2) (if (and (monitor' e a s)(member e1 s)(instance e2 e1)(Rexist e2) (goalRelevant e2 a)(etc)) (exists (e3) (and (inFocus' e3 e2 a)(cause e e3)))))
axioms.english: A weaker defeasible rule is that if we are monitoring for an eventuality type and a token actually occurs, then that will cause us to focus on it. This rule fails when something goal-relevant occurs and we don't perceive it.

axioms.title: Sufficient condition for monitoring
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2) (if (and (goalRelevant e2 a)(instance e2 e1)(etc)) (exists (s) (and (member e1 s)(monitor a s)))))
axioms.english: If an eventuality type has a goal-relevant instance, it should be monitored for. A big reason for this defeasibility is that many goal-relevant phenomena are, at the least, very difficult to perceive, such as radiation, carcinogens in the environment, and bacteria in food.

axioms.title: Definition of monitorThing
axioms.fol: (forall (a x) (iff (monitorThing a x) (exists (s) (and (monitor a s) (forall (e) (if (member e s)(arg* x e)))))))
axioms.english: Some monitoring is for events that happen to things. To monitor a thing is to monitor for events happening to the thing or states involving the thing.

axioms.title: Definition of monitorAgent
axioms.fol: (forall (a b) (iff (monitorAgent a b) (and (monitorThing a b)(agent b))))
axioms.english: Some monitoring is for events that happen to an agent.

axioms.title: Definition of monitorSelf
axioms.english: Some monitoring is for events that happen to one's own self. For example, an athlete will monitor his or her body for various conditions relevant to the performance.

axioms.title: Definition of terminateMonitor
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a s) (iff (terminateMonitor' e0 a s) (exists (e1 e2) (and (changeFrom' e2 e1)(gen e2 e0)(monitor' e1 a s)))))
axioms.english: People can stop monitoring some set of events after some time.

axioms.title: Definition of monitorTriggerCondition
axioms.fol: (forall (e) (iff (monitorTriggerCondition e) (exists (a s)(and (monitor a s)(member e s)))))
axioms.english: When monitoring, people are looking for monitor trigger conditions. These are the eventuality types in the set s.

axioms.title: Goal relevance implies good or bad
axioms.fol: (forall (e a) (if (goalRelevant e a)(or (goodFor e a)(badFor e a))))
axioms.english: We monitor for both threats and opportunities. The trigger condition can be either good for us or bad for us. In fact, it is a theorem that if an eventuality is goal relevant to an agent it is either good for or bad for the agent.

axioms.title: Definition of monitorTriggerConditionSatisfied
axioms.english: A monitored trigger condition can be satisfied.

axioms.title: Definition of monitorTriggerConditionUnsatisfied
axioms.english: A monitored trigger conditions can remain unsatisfied.

axioms.title: Definition of monitorTriggeredAction
axioms.fol: (forall (e2 e1 a s) (iff (monitorTriggeredAction e2 e1 a s) (exists (e0 s1 g) (and (monitor' e0 a s)(member e1 s) (cause e0 e2) (agentOf a e2)(goal g a) (causalComplex s1 g)(member e2 s1)))))
axioms.english: When one of the trigger conditions occurs, we typically execute some action in response. We can call this the triggered action. Action e2 is triggered by condition e1 while agent a is monitoring a set s of eventuality types. The monitoring causes action e2. Agent a is the agent of the action e2, and e2 is in a causal complex for some goal g of a's.

axioms.title: Definition of monitoringTimeSpan
axioms.fol: (forall (t e0) (iff (monitoringTimeSpan t e0) (exists (a s) (and (monitor' e0 a s)(timeSpanOf t e0)))))
axioms.english: There is a time span during which monitoring is conducted.

axioms.title: Definition of monitoringFrequency
axioms.fol: (forall (r a s t) (iff (monitoringFrequency r a s t) (exists (s1) (and (forall (e1) (if (member e1 s1)(monitor' e1 a s))) (tseq t)(rate r s1 t)))))
axioms.english: There is a frequency at which monitoring is conducted. For example, when we drive down the freeway, we monitor our distance from the car in front of us on a second-by-second basis. We monitor the presence of police cars at less frequent intervals. r is the rate of occurrence in temporal sequence t of monitoring events by agent a of eventuality types in set s.

axioms.title: Definition of monitoringFailure
axioms.fol: (forall (a s) (iff (monitoringFailure a s) (exists (e e1 e2) (and (monitor' e a s)(member e1 s)(instance e2 e1) (or (and (Rexist e2) (not (exists (e3) (and (inFocus' e3 e2 a) (cause e e3))))) (and (not (Rexist e2)) (exists (e3) (and (inFocus' e3 e2 a) (cause e e3)))))))))
axioms.english: Monitoring can fail if the triggering does not happen when the conditions are met â€“ a false negative. The event happens but the monitoring does not end up in focus. False positives are also possible; the triggering event is believed to have happened, an instance of it is in focus, but in fact the instance did not really happen.

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Extensive use of primed predicates for monitoring activities: monitor', inFocus', terminateMonitor'
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: Three axioms use (etc) condition - monitoring can fail due to perception limitations or environmental factors
conversion_notes.monitoring_framework: Comprehensive treatment of environmental surveillance as conscious subprocess of interpret-act cycle
conversion_notes.trigger_conditions: Systematic treatment of goal-relevant event detection and response mechanisms
conversion_notes.cross_references: Integration with goal theory, perception theory, attention/focus, and causal reasoning
conversion_notes.failure_modes: Formal treatment of false positives and false negatives in monitoring processes
conversion_notes.frequency_analysis: Sophisticated treatment of monitoring frequency as temporal rate with examples
conversion_notes.complex_quantification: Multiple axioms with nested quantification especially in triggered actions and failure definitions

file_format_notes.logical_structure: Mix of definitions, defeasible rules, and implications with moderate complexity
file_format_notes.predicate_consistency: Consistent use of monitoring terminology with clear semantic distinctions
file_format_notes.defeasibility_markers: Three defeasible rules with (etc) conditions for realistic monitoring limitations
file_format_notes.reification_patterns: Strategic reification of monitoring processes and attention focus relations
file_format_notes.monitoring_framework: Systematic treatment from basic monitoring through frequency analysis to failure modes
